abs: this paper, we exploit the similarities between the Gibbs sampler and the SIS, bringing over the improvements for Gibbs sampling algorithms to the SIS setting for nonparametric Bayes problems. These improvements reduce the variance of the importance sampling weights, resulting in an improved sampler, and they help satisfy questions of Diaconis (personal communication) pertaining to convergence. Such an effort can see wide applications in many other problems related to dynamic systems where the SIS is useful (Berzuini et al. 1996; Liu and Chen 1997).
title: Sequential Importance Sampling for Nonparametric Bayes Models: The Next Generation
